definition: of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)

sentences.english: You do not want to let them down...
sentences.chinese: 你的的確確不想讓他們失望。

sentences.english: As it turns out, a handful of scientific studies show that chicken soup really could have medicinal value.
sentences.chinese: 而且幾項科學研究也表明，雞湯的確具有藥用價值。

sentences.english: I accept there were some judicial mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 的確有一些審判方面的錯誤。

sentences.english: Indeed it was giraffe and deer that have woven the new dreamtime for all to partake in.
sentences.chinese: 的確，正是長頸鹿與鹿爲所有物種編織了這一新夢想。

sentences.english: That is especially true for antiretroviral therapy.
sentences.chinese: 這些對於反轉錄酶療法的確相當正確。

sentences.english: However, Taobao also have a common vision off Amoy, Taobao is indeed a lot of money.
sentences.chinese: 但是淘寶也要有淘客共同的目光，淘寶的確很賺錢。

sentences.english: Several findings do indeed point to the importance of ESPs.
sentences.chinese: 一些研究結果的確證實了ESP的重要性。

sentences.english: But this one was a Christmas emergency.
sentences.chinese: 但這的確是個聖誕節急診。

sentences.english: God really does change his people.
sentences.chinese: 神的確在改變他的子民。

sentences.english: in fact, building sucess is base on the binding of the two .
sentences.chinese: 事實上，成功的確建立在兩方面完全融合的基礎上。

sentences.english: And let there be no mistake: The blood is definitely running right now on Wall Street.
sentences.chinese: 毋庸贅言，現在華爾街的確已經是血流成河了。

sentences.english: The atmosphere is indeed getting tensed.
I can't think of names, but there are some really cool people.
sentences.chinese: 我想不起他們的名字來，但是他們的確做得不錯。

sentences.english: The Bells of Bow Church spoke truly when they chimed to young Dick.
sentences.chinese: 當年包教堂的鐘聲對年輕的迪克的確說了真話。

sentences.english: I was too tired to be active. And it did comfort me greatly seeing Zhihui there .
sentences.chinese: 結果是我精神不振，但看到志慧時的確覺得很溫馨。

definition: after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
regarding/as far as sth is concerned/with regards to
only/merely/nothing but/no more than/it's just that ...
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
